text: I've been putting on a brave face at work every day, but I've been secretly struggling with anxiety attacks in the bathroom stalls.
When people ask if I'm okay, I always say yes. I haven't been honest about my depression with anyone except my therapist.
I thought I was the only man in Jamaica who cried himself to sleep. Reading the stories here made me feel less alone for the first time in years.
My family thinks I'm just being lazy, but some days my depression makes it impossible to even get out of bed. I wish they understood mental illness is real.
I've been in therapy for 6 months now. Today I laughed and realized it was the first time I'd genuinely felt happy in over a year. There is hope.
I've been hiding my medication from my roommates because I'm afraid they'd judge me for having bipolar disorder.
Today I told my pastor about my mental health struggles. Instead of judgment, he shared his own experience with depression. I feel so relieved.
I smiled through my cousin's wedding last weekend while having the worst anxiety episode of my life. No one noticed. We've become too good at hiding our pain.
Started medication for anxiety last month. The difference is like night and day. Wish I hadn't waited 3 years to get help.
I tell everyone I'm doing great at university, but I've been having panic attacks before every exam. I'm afraid of disappointing my family if I fail.
